Articles.Content:
Here is my stock replica of the Grunder Industries ADFX-01 Morgan from the Ace Combat series! ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif)

Download: [http://kerbalx.com/Blesbok/Grunder-Ind-ADFX-01-Morgan.craft](http://kerbalx.com/Blesbok/Grunder-Ind-ADFX-01-Morgan.craft)

Enjoy!

-Blesbok

![nfDoyfB.png](http://i.imgur.com/nfDoyfB.png)

amazing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

every ace combat replica is good ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) but i prefer the CFA-44

> 
> amazing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> every ace combat replica is good ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) but i prefer the CFA-44

I have a hard time finding an original Ace Combat plane that isn't a forward-swept wing similar to the Morgan or the Falken.

I guess advanced meant forward-swept wings to Project Aces and Namco.

> 
> I have a hard time finding an original Ace Combat plane that isn't a forward-swept wing similar to the Morgan or the Falken.
> I guess advanced meant forward-swept wings to Project Aces and Namco.

I know right?

Don't forget about the XFA-27!

[http://acecombat.wikia.com/wiki/XFA-27](http://acecombat.wikia.com/wiki/XFA-27)

It's from Ace Combat 2 and the first flyable super-plane in the series.

Realy 80's sci-fi-looking and still my favorite!

Cool Morgan replica btw.

It looks like the "real" thing!
